Package specific

Class EnterEvent

java.lang.Object
general.Event
specific.EnterEvent
public class EnterEvent extends Event
Represents a specific type of event when a customer enters the store. This class extends the Event class to handle customer entry, including checking the store's capacity and deciding whether the customer can start picking items or if they are turned away due to the store being at maximum capacity. Note: This event is not displayed in the StoreView update as per assignment requirements.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnterEvent

      public EnterEvent(float time, MakeCustomer customer, StoreState storeState)
      Constructs an EnterEvent with specified time, customer, and store state. Initializes the event with the given parameters and sets the event name to "EnterEvent".
      Parameters:
      time - The execution time of this event.
      customer - The customer associated with this event.
      storeState - The current state of the store when this event occurs.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public Event execute()
      Executes the event and updating the store state. It checks if the store is at its maximum capacity. If so, it increments the count of missed customers in the store state. Otherwise, it increments the current capacity of the store state and schedules a new PickEvent for the customer to start picking items. This reflects the customer's transition from entering to actively shopping.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Event
      Returns:
      A new PickEvent if the customer can enter, otherwise null.

    • scheduleNextEventTime

      public float scheduleNextEventTime()
      Calculates the time for the next event based on the current event time and a random pick time from the store state. This time indicates when the customer will stop picking items.
      Returns:
      The time for the next event.
